intro: Guatteria diospyroides subsp. hondurensis, commonly known as Honduran persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Honduras, Guatemala, and parts of Mexico. The plant is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptic in shape, with a glossy upper surface and a lighter underside. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns from green to orange-red when mature, and is edible when fully ripe.
